gurmukhi: Ab eyk kIey ibnu XO n trY ] doaU dwNqn pIs hMkwr prY ] jb lO n suno lv Kyq mrw ] qb lau n lKy rn bwn trw ]115]
transliteration: Abe K Keee Bin(u) Yau Na Darai|| Dooo Daantan Pees Hankaar Darai|| Jah Lau Na Douno Lav Khet Maraa|| Tab Lau Na Lakhe Ran Baan Taraa||115||
translation: The king was determined to kill him and body of the enemies, grinding their teeth and challenging each other began to fight violently; the king did not stop the showering of arrows, as he waited to get the news of the death of Lavansaura.115.

gurmukhi: Ab hI rix eyk kI eyk krY ] ibn eyk kIey rix qy n trY ] bhu swl islw ql biRC Cuty ] duhU Er jbY rx bIr juty ]116]
transliteration: Abhiran(i) Ek Kiek Darai|| Bin Ek Keee Ran(i) Ten A Darai|| Bahu Saal Silaa Tal Brichh Chhoute|| Duhoo Or Jabai Ran Beer Joute||116||
translation: Both of them had the same objective and did not want to leave the battle without killing the opponent; both the warriors showered trees and stones etc. from both the sides.116.

gurmukhi: kup kY lv pwn qiRsUl lXo ] isr DwqXmwn duKMf kXo ] bhu jUQ pjUQn sYn BjI ] n aucwie skY isr AYs ljI ]117]
transliteration: Koup Kai Lav Paan Trisnl Layo|| Sir Dhaataymaan Doukhanndkayo|| Bahu Joojh Pajeethan Sain Bhajee|| Na Ouchaae Sakai Sir Ais Lajee||117||
translation: Lavanasura held his trident in his hand in anger and chopped the head of Mandhata into two parts; the army of Mandhata ran away, being grouped together and got so much ashmed that it could not carry the head of the king.117.

gurmukhi: Gin jYs Bjy Gn Gwiel huAY ] brKw ijm sRoxq Dwr cuAY ] suB mwn mhIpq CyqH dY ] sB hI dl Bwg clw jIA lY ]118]
transliteration: Ghan(i) Jais Bhaje Ghan Ghaail Huai|| Barkhaa Jim Sronat Dhaar Chuai|| Soubh Maan Maheepat Chhetrah Kai|| Sabh Hikal Bhaag Chalaa Jeea Lai||118||
translation: The army, getting wounded, flew away like clouds and the blood flowed as if it was raining; abandoning the dead king in the battlefield, the whole army of the king saved itself by fleeing away.118.

gurmukhi: iek GUmq Gwiel sIs Puty ] iek sRox cucwvq kys Cuty ] rx mwr kY mwin qiRsUl lIey ] Bt BwNqih BwNq Bjwie dIey ]119]
transliteration: Ik Ghoomat Ghaail Sees Phoute|| Ik Snon Chouchaavadkes Chhoute|| Ran Maar Kai Maan(i) Trisool Leee|| Bhat Bhaantah(i) Bhaant Bhajaae Deee||119||
translation: Those who returned, their heads cracked, their hair were loosened and being wounded, the blood flowed form their heads; in this way, Lavanasura won the battle on the strength of his trident and caused the warriors of many kinds to run away.119.
End of the killing of Mandhata.
Now begins the description of the rule of Dileep

gurmukhi: rx mo jn mwn mhIp hey ] qb Awn idlIp idlIs Bey ] bhu BwNqn dwnv dIh dly ] sB TOr sBO auT Drm pry ]120]
transliteration: Ran Mo Jan Maan Maheep Hae|| Tab Aan Dilip Dilees Bhae|| Bahu Bhaantan Daanav Deeh Dale|| Sabh Thaur Sabhau Outh Dharma Dare||120||
translation: When Mandhata was killed in the war, then Dileep became the king of Delhi; he destroyed the demons in various ways and propagated religion at all places.120.

gurmukhi: jb niRp hnw mwnDwqw br ] iSv qiRsUl kr Dir lvnwsur ] BXo dlIp jgq ko rwjw ] BwNq BwNq ijh rwj ibrwjw ]121]
transliteration: Jab Neip Hanaa Maandhaataa Bar|| Shiv Trishool Kar Dhar(i) Lavanaasur|| Bhayo Daleep Jagad Ko Raajaa|| Bhaant Bhaant Jih Raaj Biraajaa||121||
translation: When taking the trident of Shiva, Lavanasura killed the superb king mandhata, then the king Dileep came to the throne; he had various types of royal luxuries.121.

gurmukhi: mhwrQI Aru mhw niRpwrw ] klk Avit swcy jnu Fwrw ] Aiq suMdr jnu mdn srUpw ] jwnuk bny rUp ko BUpw ]122]
transliteration: Mahaarathiar(u) Mahaa Nripaaraa|| Kanak Avat(i) Saache Jan(u) Dhaaaa|| At(i) Soundar Jan(u) Madn Daroopaa|| Jaanouk Bade Roop Ko Bhoopaa||122||
translation: This king was a great warrior any Sovereign; it seemed that he had been shaped in a mould of gold; like the form of the god of love, this king was so beautiful, that he appeared to be the Sovereign of Beauty.122.

gurmukhi: bhu ibiD kry j`g ibsQwrw ] ibDvq hom dwn mKswrw ] Drm Dujw jh qhw ibrwjI ] ieMdRwvqI inrK duiq lwjI ]123]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Dare Jagg Bishaaraa|| Bidhvat Hom Daan Makh-saaraa|| Dharam Dhujaa Joh Tahaa Biraajee|| Indraavati Nitakh Dout(i) Laajee||123||
translation: He performed various types of Yajnas and executed hom and bestowed charities according to Vedic injunctions; his banner of the extension of Dharma fluttered here and there and seeing his glory, the abode of Indra felt shy.123.
